caption.p: The Main Mechanism of COVID-related Thrombosis.

graphic.alt-text: Diagram illustrating the process of vascular injury and inflammation due to viral infection. It shows endothelial damage through ACE2 and PAR-2 pathways, leading to dysfunction, apoptosis, and hypercoagulability. A cytokine storm activates immune responses, while platelet and complement activation contribute to thrombus formation. Key components like spike protein, ACE2 receptors, and factors like IL-1α, IL-6, and TNF-α are highlighted. The diagram emphasizes the progression from endothelial damage to inflammation and immune activation, resulting in blood clot formation.
